extracted_sections.section_title: Comprehensive Guide to Major Cities in the South of France

extracted_sections.document: South of France - Things to Do.pdf
South of France - Restaurants and Hotels.pdf

subsection_analysis.refined_text: Nice: Explore the Promenade des Anglais, Old Town, and Castle Hill for panoramic views. Consider a day trip to Eze Village for its medieval charm and exotic garden.

subsection_analysis.document: South of France - Things to Do.pdf
subsection_analysis.refined_text: Canyoning in the Gorges du Verdon: An exhilarating activity for adventure seekers, offering stunning natural beauty and a thrilling experience.
Bouillabaisse: A traditional Provencal fish stew, best enjoyed with croutons and rouille. Look for restaurants specializing in authentic local dishes.

subsection_analysis.document: South of France - Restaurants and Hotels.pdf
subsection_analysis.refined_text: Le Chantecler (Nice): A two-Michelin-starred restaurant offering exquisite French Riviera cuisine in a luxurious setting. Reservations highly recommended.
Palais des Papes (Avignon): A UNESCO World Heritage site, this grand Gothic palace was once the seat of the papacy. Allow ample time for exploration.
